title: exclamation mark not working in passwords
author: Matrix651
body_snippet:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->
Exclamation mark in passwords not working. 

## Expected Behavior
<!--- If you're describing a bug, tell us what should happen -->
<!--- If you're suggesting a change/improvement, tell us how it should work -->

## Current Behavior
<!--- If describing a bug, tell us what happens instead of the expected behavior -->
All saved connections with an exclamation mark in the password will be aborted with a connection error. Wh...

iterations.description: EscapeSendKeys() in ConnectionContextMenu.cs omits '!' from its special-char list, causing SendKeys to interpret it as the Alt modifier instead of a literal character when sending passwords.

comments.author: kees-z
comments.snippet:
Already discussed in #1651 and #1664 
Use an exclamation mark in the variable name (`%!password%` or `%!username%`) to prevent metacharacter escaping and argument splitting.

notes:
AI triage (claude): EscapeSendKeys() in ConnectionContextMenu.cs omits '!' from its special-char list, causing SendKeys to interpret it as the Alt modifier instead of a literal character when sending passwords.
Approach: Add '!' to the EscapeSendKeys() condition at line 1136 in ConnectionContextMenu.cs; also apply EscapeSendKeys (or equivalent) to finalCommand in PuttyBase.cs:247 before calling SendKeys.SendWait.
